description: Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney. Two prominent Australian founder-led businesses have taken a market hit. But first...Today’s must-reads:• WiseTech board reviews allegations against CEO Richard White • Mineral Resources probes payments to tycoon founder• Qantas Airways faces a multi-million dollar payout
title: CEO Probes Hit Share Prices

description: Despite a decades-long ban on women taking jobs as domestics in other countries, tens of thousands are emigrating every year.
title: Nepal’s Women Evade Border Guards and Suspicious Husbands to Find Work Abroad

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg antitrust reporter Leah Nylen looks at a poll of voters’ attitudes toward antitrust enforcement. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: It’s the Antitrust Era for 2024 Voters Suspicious of Big Companies

description: Two senior congressional Republicans are targeting Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan for appearing publicly with House Democrats weeks before the November election.
title: FTC’s Khan Targeted by Two GOP Lawmakers for ‘Campaign’ Trips

description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government is pushing through new legislation in a bid to salvage her controversial plan on illegal migration, after a court in Rome blocked her long-delayed program to divert asylum seekers to Albania.
title: Meloni Approves New Law to Rescue Flagship Albania Migrant Plan

description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha met with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in Ankara for talks on cooperation in the defense sector and the importance of free navigation in the Black Sea, Ukraine’s Foreign Ministry said in an emailed statement Monday.
title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Sybiha Meets With Turkey’s Erdogan

description: Serbia’s President Aleksandar Vucic says he won’t attend an annual BRICS summit this week as the Balkan country tries to balance its ties with Russia with efforts to join the European Union and to improve relations with US.
title: Serbia’s Vucic to Skip BRICS Summit Despite Putin Invite

description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken took off Monday for his 11th visit to the Mideast in his so-far unsuccessful effort to engineer a cease-fire between Israel and Iran-backed militants since the attack on Israel more than a year ago.
title: Blinken Takes Off in 11th Attempt to Reach a Middle East Cease-Fire

description: Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel warned citizens there would be consequences for taking to the streets as many on the island were still without power after more than 72 hours.
title: Cuba Warns Against Protests as It Struggles to Restore Power

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the US will provide $800 million of military support to Ukraine to finance the production of drones as the country seeks to bolster its defense capabilities.
title: Zelenskiy Says US to Give Ukraine $800 Million for Drone Production

description: Donald Trump castigated the federal government’s response to Hurricane Helene, repeating unsubstantiated claims that relief funds were spent on undocumented migrants instead of storm victims as the Republican nominee seeks to turn out voters in battleground North Carolina.
title: Trump Tries to Use Helene Response in Appeal to North Carolina Voters

description: Vice President Kamala Harris criticized Donald Trump for sidestepping a question about whether he would back increasing the minimum wage, a day after her Republican opponent held a campaign stop at a McDonald’s Corp. restaurant.
title: Harris Enlists Cheney to Win Anti-Trump Republicans in Blue Wall States

description: Donald Trump, who rose to political power fueled by grassroots contributors giving in small increments, is now reliant on wealthy backers, including billionaires Elon Musk and Miriam Adelson, to underwrite his third White House bid.
title: Trump Relies on Billionaire Donors to Fund 2024 Race Against Harris

description: Starting in the 1940s, Turkey, wary of Moscow, positioned itself as an ally of the US and soon after joined NATO, the military alliance founded to protect Europe against Soviet attack during the Cold War. Since coming to power in 2003, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has gradually reinvented Turkey as a power in its own right that’s free to make new friends even if it upsets the old ones. In the past decade, it’s been courting a number of US adversaries — China, Russia and Iran — as distrust of W
title: Why Turkey, a NATO Member, Wants to Join BRICS

description: The low-boil conflict between Israel and Iran has shaped the Middle East for decades. Of the many conflicts that have roiled the region, theirs has long been among the most explosive. The two have attacked each other — mostly quietly and in Iran’s case often by proxy — while avoiding an escalation into direct war.
title: Israel Versus Iran: How Their Conflict Shapes the Middle East

description: Donald Trump’s agenda for a second presidential term would drive Social Security to insolvency three years earlier and eventually slash benefits by nearly a third, a nonpartisan budget watchdog group estimated Monday.
title: Trump’s Plans Set Social Security Benefits Up for 33% Cut, Watchdog Warns

description: Venezuela detained former Oil Minister Pedro Tellechea over the weekend as part of an internal purge at the state oil company after President Nicolás Maduro’s disputed reelection.
title: Venezuela Arrests Former Oil Minister in Latest State Purge

description: Donald Trump is facing a defamation lawsuit over comments he made during the September presidential debate about five men who were wrongly convicted in the 1989 jogger rape case and came to be known as the “Central Park Five.”
title: Trump Sued for Defamation by Exonerated ‘Central Park Five’

description: Colombia became the latest Latin American country to raise tariffs on Chinese steel, as producers complain of the threat to local jobs from cheap imports.
title: Colombia Hikes Tariffs on Cheap Steel Imports From China

description: They rose to power as the answer to social unrest in the unequal region. Now, their misses may make room for the return of more business-friendly governments.
title: Struggling Socialists Open Door for Businesses in Latin America

description: Eles chegaram ao poder como a resposta à agitação social numa região desigual. Agora, seus erros podem abrir espaço para o retorno de governos mais amigáveis ​​ao setor empresarial.
title: Líderes de esquerda falham em promessas por toda América Latina

description: Líderes progresistas llegaron al poder como respuesta al malestar social en la región. Pero sus escasos logros políticos y sociales allanan el camino para el regreso de gobiernos promercado.
title: Promesas fallidas están pasando la cuenta a la izquierda latinoamericana

description: The UK Labour government’s package of workers’ rights reforms could cost businesses as much as £4.5 billion ($5.9 billion) per year, with small firms disproportionately impacted, according to an economic analysis of the policy.
title: UK Employment Reforms to Cost Firms Up to £4.5 Billion a Year

description: The US Supreme Court declined to hear an appeal that sought to give the president control over agencies that have long operated independently, potentially including the Federal Trade Commission and Securities and Exchange Commission.
title: Supreme Court Rejects Bid to Let President Fire Agency Leaders

description: The US Supreme Court refused to open Donald Trump to a lawsuit by his former lawyer and fixer, Michael Cohen, who says he was returned to prison because he wouldn’t promise not to publicly criticize his onetime boss.
title: Trump Averts Michael Cohen Suit as Supreme Court Rejects Appeal

description: McDonald’s Corp. said it’s not taking sides in the presidential election following Donald Trump’s visit to a Pennsylvania restaurant on Sunday.
title: McDonald’s Tells Workers It Doesn’t Endorse Political Candidates After Trump Visit

description: All versions of the F-35, the world’s costliest weapons program, have failed to meet minimum combat readiness rates for six straight years, according to the watchdog agency for Congress.
title: World’s Costliest Weapons Program Failed to Hit Readiness Marks for Six Years, GAO Says

description: Seven Israelis have been arrested on suspicion of spying for Iran in exchange for hundreds of thousands of dollars, Israeli police and security officials say.
title: Israel Arrests Seven Citizens Suspected of Spying for Iran

description: Gunmen killed at least seven workers, and injured five others, at a key tunnel project in Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday, according to the police, making it one of the worst attacks on an infrastructure project in the volatile Indian region.
title: India’s Kashmir Sees Major Attack on Migrant Workers Since Polls

description: India said it ended a four-year border stalemate with China, a significant step toward easing tensions and paving the way for a possible meeting between the leaders of both nuclear-armed countries at a BRICS summit this week.
title: China, India End Border Impasse Ahead of Likely Xi-Modi Meet

description: Mozambique faces a fresh flash point over Oct. 9 elections after opposition presidential candidate Venâncio Mondlane called for mass attendance at the funeral of his lawyer, who was murdered at the weekend.
title: Mozambique Police Use Teargas to Disperse Protesters, Reporters

description: Moldova voted in favor of opening a path to European Union membership in the coming years by a slim margin as the former Soviet republic sought to break the Kremlin’s decades-long grip.
title: Moldova Approves EU Membership Path With Razor-Thin Margin
